alert.note: Alert for Washington (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 17 at 8:19AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN POTTAWATTAMIE...SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON AND NORTHEASTERN DOUGLAS COUNTIES... At 819 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over northeastern Omaha, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. This storm has a history of producing up to golf ball size hail in the Arlington and Fremont areas. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. This severe storm will be near... Crescent and Eppley Airfield around 825 AM CDT. Northern Council Bluffs around 830 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Council Bluffs Airport. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
